thread.title: H.S. ROUNDUP: Milton Academy offense back on track
thread.title_full: H.S. ROUNDUP: Milton Academy offense back on track

author: The Patriot Ledger
title: H.S. ROUNDUP: Milton Academy offense back on track
text: H.S. ROUNDUP: Milton Academy offense back on track Behind the strong running of Mike Silva and Freddy Okito, Milton Academy improved to 3-1 with a 34-26 victory over Buckingham Browne & Nichols Comment The Patriot Ledger, Quincy, MA By The Patriot Ledger Posted Oct. 18, 2015 at 9:26 PM Updated at 9:32 PM Posted Oct. 18, 2015 at 9:26 PM Updated at 9:32 PM The Milton Academy offense got on track in a 34-26 victory over Buckingham Browne & Nichols Saturday. Junior Mike Silva (23 carries, 194 yards, 3 TDs) led a strong rushing attack for the Mustangs (3-1), while junior Freddy Okito added 148 yards on six carries, including a a 15-yard TD. Defensively, senior Quintin McDermott recorded seven tackles and had two interceptions for the Mustangs. In other high school action: Football Archbishop Williams 35, Austin Prep 0: Senior running back Marcus McBean ran for 250 yards and three TDs as the Bishops (4-2) rolled on the road. Braintree 41, Brookline 0: The Wamps pitched a shutout in the homecoming weekend victory. Duxbury 42, Silver Lake 3:Junior quarterback Bobby Maimaron threw five TD passes as the Green Dragons (5-1) cruised to the victory on the road. David Colucci and Joe Gooley each found the end zone twice for Duxbury. Old Colony 49, Sacred Heart 16: The Saints dropped to 0-5 on the season. South Shore Votech 30, Cape Cod Tech 6: Vikings head coach Derek Mariani notched his 100th career victory. Senior quarterback Kyle Thompson (Hanson) helped Mariani reach the milestone with 11 carries for 98 yards and a touchdown. Richie Lobo (Scituate) carried the ball 14 times for 84 yards and a score. Defensively, James Huff had a a 23-yard interception return for a touchdown for the Vikings (4-2). St. George’s 49, Thayer 21:The Tigers scored all their points in the first half, as they were unable to come up with the win on the road. Jamari Venter (10 carries, 47 yards) returned an interception 70 yards for a touchdown to cut the lead to 28-21, but that was as close as the Tigers got. Sophomore quarterback Cole Roland completed 17-of-31 passes for 207 yards, including a 75-yard TD strike to Declan Donahue (8 catches, 120 yards). Sophomore Kevin Deree (5 catches, 57 yards) had a solid day. Boys soccer Whitman-Hanson 2, Quincy 0: Senior Brian McGahan had both goals for the Panthers (4-9, 3-8 Patriot League) in the victory. Nick Haley and Tom McGahan added assists, while goalkeeper Conor Keane recorded his second shutout of the season. Girls soccer Sacred Heart 11, Bishop Connolly 1: Junior Olivia DiBiase (2 assists) had a hat trick in a big victory for the Saints. Senior Caroline Sheen (assist), junior Bridget LeBlanc (assist), sophomores Rose Crossman (2 assists) all added goals in the win, which saw nine Saints score. Whitman-Hanson 4, Weymouth 0: Rachel Kelly and Lauren Bonavita both scored in the first 10 minutes of the second half for the Panthers (12-0) to open the scoring. Alexis Fruzzetti and Taylor Kofton also found the back of the net. On defense, Kat O’Kane, Kelsey Gilbert, Madison Shea and Elana Wood played well in front of keeper Skylar Kuzmich (seven saves), who earned her ninth shutout this season. Page 2 of 2 - Milton Academy 1, BB&N 0: Junior Brie Lawson connected with senior Ashley Adelberg for the lone goal in the Mustangs’ victory. Junior goalkeeper Christina Sakellaris earned the shutout. Silver Lake 2, North Quincy 0: Seniors Cassie Murphy and Ashley Arroyo each scored goals in the Lakers’ (8-4-2, 6-3-1 Patriot League) victory at home. Senior Michala Callahan chipped in both assists. Senior Becca Hapgood and sophomores Allie Crawford and Meghan Supple all played well for the Lakers, controlling the midfield. Field Hockey Braintree 1, Natick 1: The Wamps played to a tie at home. Boys Cross Country Hingham finished fifth at the CM Invitational held at Franklin Park in Boston on Saturday. Hingham was the highest finisher of all the Division 3 schools at the meet. All nine runners for Hingham completed the race between 15th and 88th place in a field of more than 300 runners. The top five finishers for the Harbormen were Jack Muldoon (15th place, 17:15), Ivan Frantz (20th place, 17:21), Evan Goddard (27th place, 17:31), Pete Ross (39th place, 17:47), and Liam Nolan (44th place, 18:02). By The Patriot Ledger The Patriot Ledger, Quincy, MA By The Patriot Ledger Posted Oct. 18, 2015 at 9:26 PM Updated at 9:32 PM
